tweets.text: This is about a lot more than the smell of a landfill. Emissions of hydrogen sulphide are way in excess of WHO guidelines. The @EnvAgency has been slow to act but is now starting to get somewhere. The firm has in the past resorted to threatening local people and the local MP.

Brilliant conference this morning for our #plasticchampions with over 120 @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK and other @UKCivilService attendees. Inspirational talks from @PlasticWaive and @UoPPlastics too. https://t.co/xsxivxQBpY

Environment Agency identifies 5 permit breaches & detects hydrogen sulphide levels that exceed WHO recommendations following 1000s of complaints.

RED Industries are "acutely aware" of concerns but will nonetheless keep adding waste to the landfill until 2026.

Article below ⬇️
Representing 100s who couldn't make it, they did a brilliant job. https://t.co/UcNk87Uijz

@Maze_fb Really @RedIndustries2  sponsoring Clayton roundabout is that because they are so proud their toxic stink has reached that far? Was that the idea @NewsNBC @PHE_uk @StaffordshireCC @EnvAgencyMids Recognising great toxic air pollution achievement #stopthestink @StinkStopthe
@NewcastleTownFC https://t.co/BrFt34c7bL

I am sick and tired of living near to #walleysquarrey @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_uk @PHE_WestMids @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA My head throbs, my nose is swollen, my mind spins, my heart longs for peace from this nightmare. @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off #StopTheStink

@RedIndustries2 @EnvAgencyMids looking at the readings from peoples devices you have alot to answer for. It will be a relief for many people when you are shut down and hopefully charged as you rightly should be. @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off https://t.co/gNDoJU2MzX

Welcome to Newcastle 😡 and this is what will cause the demise of our local hospitality and shops. No-one wants to eat, drink or shop with that toxic, harmful gas around. @NewsNBC @StinkStopthe @PHE_uk @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids #StopTheStink #capitoff https://t.co/e3bl7O43rG
Any comment @EnvAgency ? https://t.co/Q43VJI0iMZ

tweets.text:
The coarse fish close season runs until 15th June inclusive. This means it’s illegal to fish for coarse fish in rivers.

Don’t forget, there are plenty of still waters or canal coarse fisheries where you can fish. 

Learn more: https://t.co/u6IhTpkgUB https://t.co/9Tpaa6XWIW

Last week Rural & Business Officers, in partnership with @EnvAgency visited scrap-dealers around North Worcestershire to combat the illegal catalytic converter trade. 
For information on how to protect your vehicle from thieves click here - https://t.co/Tnlzeo8RKZ https://t.co/oDjZAdRgAT
If @AnglianWater and @EnvAgency apparently don't attend for this, what do they attend for? https://t.co/WYJVcXNNdG

tweets.text:
Flood Alerts for River Hull Central and Lower River Hull have now been removed following this evening's high tide at 4.3m at 7.30 pm.

Earlier issues with the operation of the Hull Tidal Barrier have now been fully resolved ahead of further high tides tomorrow.

#FloodAware https://t.co/7ZNq4UzOVu

Taking a look through the impact statements & testimonies received yesterday from @StinkStopthe as we scan them in and send to @EnvAgencyMids and the landfill operator. It is clear that 100s of people are having their lives disrupted by the foul stink from Walleys Quarry. https://t.co/raHIxVgyvH

Each UK farm can expect only 1 @EnvAgency inspection every 263 years: Devastating report out today by @SalmonTroutCons on the collapse and defunding of agri pollution enforcement in the UK https://t.co/R3l3xsAV8B

#Gramoxone #Paraquat #Glyphosate?surely time has come for compulsory riparian buffer zones this poison has been sprayed alongside a Chalk stream 🤷‍♂️I struggle to find a reason why the landowner would do this @theriverstrust Sewage💩Agricultural runoff💩Abstraction🥵Weedkiller☠️ https://t.co/ESdNaPCNC6 https://t.co/FY0Nof8hOt
@River_Care @KeepBritainTidy @AnglianWater @SincilC @thelincolnite @EnvAgencyMids @SincilBankVenue @lincolncouncil @Lincoln_BIG @UoLEnvironment Fantastic work!

tweets.text: It was fantastic to see Sincil Bank RiverCare return to action in Lincoln 💚 In small groups they cleared 38 bags of litter pollution, alongside 2 printers, a rocking horse, hoover, toaster, children’s car seats, parts of a fridge, 2 tyres & 8 traffic cones 🙌 #LitterHeroes https://t.co/JKCcPAXLHt

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

urls.title: Start of the close season: How do we protect our breeding fish at this time of year?
urls.description: Matt Buck, Fisheries Technical Specialist for the Midlands, explains how close season helps protect our breeding fish. Well the evenings are getting lighter, and across the country fish are starting to move out of their winter haunts - a sure …

urls.title: Amazon’s Carbon Footprint Grows 15% Despite Green Pledges
urls.description: Amazon said June 23 that its carbon footprint rose 15% last year, even as it launched initiatives to reduce its harm on the environment.
